description.narrative: Models for operationalizing national child friendly schools and system developed and tested in disadvantaged counties and used to inform implementation at national level.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

title.narrative: China United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 China: Evaluation of NWCCW-UNICEF Joint Child Friendly Spaces Project in China (2008-2017)
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Models for operationalizing national child friendly schools and system developed and tested in disadvantaged counties and used to inform implementation at national level.

description.narrative: Factoring in the impact brought by COVID-19 pandemic, on-site activities to support operationalizing child friendly schools have been delayed or dropped in 2020. The focus has been placed on supporting the Government's Safe Return to School initiative. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/07/2020

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Schools that received support from UNICEF through the child-friendly school or similar model

actual.value: 2019:(a) 224 schools supported through capacity development of teachers and principals on SEL for rural and ethnic children; (b) 274 schools supported through capacity development of subject teachers and principals to improve rural children's effective learning; (c) 500 schools supported through PE teach
